title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at International Community Health Services
Interview Descriptions: It was very Good and smooth, respectful, very nice staff and setting. Serving mostly immigrant. Have a lot of possibilities for future career path. I am done with 30 words

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at International Community Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward questions, took about 1.5 hours including a clinical scenario. Two interviewers were present. Friendly process overall. Provided feedback through out and guided to answer their question in the way they want to see.
Interview Questions: Typical job interview questions like why this company, handling conflicts, clinical scnarios, etc...

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at International Community Health Services
Interview Descriptions: Professionally established interviews focus on the skills you have, sounds like they care about their community other than a lot of other profit health services. Recommended to give it a try, and put your questions upfront.
Interview Questions: Why did you decide to leave last place?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at International Community Health Services in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. Very pleasant administrative staff member reached out within 24 hours to schedule phone screen.

This is the 2nd time I have interviewed with ICHS, interestingly for the same position just a few years apart. I figured the first time this happened was a fluke, but the same issue occurred so its worth giving feedback. This is the only FQHC I have ever interviewed at, for Director-level positions, that ghosts candidates post-interview. I truly have never experienced this anywhere else. Ghosting candidates is, in general, not ideal, but tends to happen with entry-level positions with a high volume applicants and interviews. But to ghost candidates for Director-level positions where you may run into those people in this not-so-small field of community health? It reflects so poorly.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background and experience.

title: Health Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was sluggish and the hiring managers are very disrespectful. After the interview, I was offered the role, and then I was told to wait while they talk amongst themselves about when I should start working. I waited for weeks and no response. They GHOSTED ME, and I still haven't heard back from them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at International Community Health Services
Interview Descriptions: First will get invitation to interview. Then will meet with hiring team and get asked questions. The questions are typical interview questions. Then will wait for their response that can take weeks depending on their applicant pool.
Interview Questions: Typical questions you can expect from interview

title: Quality Assurance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone screening by the program director, followed by an in-person interview with 4 current staff including the program director, the person currently in the role, the role's supervisor, and a colleague.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience with/doing...XYZ (items from the job posting).

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Shoreline, WA) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two nurses about how I would handle certain situations such as potential HIPAA violations as well as how I handled previous work experiences involving conflict and critical thinking. There was also a written test involving case studies and prioritization.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time that you experienced conflict at work and how you resolved it.

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Short. They short staff so they don't care who they hire. The Inteview short they seem like they need me. It was noticeable.  They were nice but the pay offered low.  They tell me I would get more after 3 months did not happen.  Be careful if you work here. You have to speak the language or they mean to you.
Interview Questions: If you have problem how do you handle?

title: Health Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Bad experience ever in my life. Two People conducted this interview. Both of them had strong accent and made it hard to answer.  I supposed they were not from US, but they need to practice their English Proficiency.

title: PSR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Bellevue, WA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: After I had applied, I got a response for an interview within the same week. The interview  was very simple and to the point. Most of the questions were based on how we would interact with patients who's first language is not english. The follow up after the interview took about 1 month until I finally heard back from them about the job.
Interview Questions: If a patient came into the clinic with a pain in their tooth, but did not have an appointment what would you do? (Answer based on your dental experience)

title: Medical Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submit Application and resume  waiting for interview, after interview waiting about 1 wk they gave me result , we have orientation and drug test before you start work, and training process take about 1-3  months

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I got an email after submitting my  resume and the process is relatively quick within 2 weeks. There were 4 people interviewing me, I think it was their different group lead (Eligibility, PSR, Call Center, ETC). They took turns to ask questions that were listed on their package.
Interview Questions: Which group would you be interested in working with (Medical Records, Call Center, PSR, Eligibility)?

title: Patient Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at International Community Health Services (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with supervisors, was asked with basic questions about work ethics, problem solving, cultural awareness. Basically, just be honest, answer all the questions truthfully, and have the passion to serve undeserved community
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?
